body_html:
@jmaye best way to do transfer learning for now is using tf.train.init_from_checkpoint. Example:

with tf.variable_scope('transferred'):
  # build transferred part of the graph
tf.train.init_from_checkpoint(checkpoint_path, {'old_scope': 'transferred'})
# rest should work seamless.
body_text:
@jmaye best way to do transfer learning for now is using tf.train.init_from_checkpoint. Example:
with tf.variable_scope('transferred'):
  # build transferred part of the graph
tf.train.init_from_checkpoint(checkpoint_path, {'old_scope': 'transferred'})
# rest should work seamless.
body:
@jmaye best way to do transfer learning for now is using [tf.train.init_from_checkpoint](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/train/init_from_checkpoint). Example:

```
with tf.variable_scope('transferred'):
  # build transferred part of the graph
tf.train.init_from_checkpoint(checkpoint_path, {'old_scope': 'transferred'})
# rest should work seamless. 
```
